intro: Impatiens obanensis, commonly known as the Oban impatiens, is a species of flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and rocky crevices. It has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that release seeds when disturbed. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation efforts.
